title: Magnetism in EuAlSi and the Eu1-xSrxAlSi Solid Solution
authors:
Dorota I. Walicka, Olivier Blacque, Karolina Gornicka, Jonathan S.
  White, Tomasz Klimczuk, Fabian O. von Rohr
abstract:
The magnetic properties of EuAlSi, a compound comprising a honeycomb lattice
of Al and Si atoms and a triangular lattice of Eu atoms, are presented.
Moreover, we have prepared the Eu1-xSrxAlSi solid solution, to study the
evolution of the collective quantum properties from the ferromagnetic EuAlSi
towards the superconducting SrAlSi. A possible quantum critical point is
suggested to exist in the vicinity of to x of 0.96, at which the suppression of
ferromagnetic order is concomitant with the emergence of superconductivity.
